intro: Hieracium pallescens subsp. anthyllidifolium, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has hairy stems and leaves that are often grayish in appearance. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, elongated achenes as fruits. It is generally a short-lived perennial and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
